key_title: Key to the species of Tasmannia

source.author: Raleigh, R.E.; Entwisle, T.J.
source.title: Winteraceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Raleigh, R.E.; Entwisle, T.J. (1996). Winteraceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Mature leaves 2 cm long or more (usually longer than 3 cm); mature berries black
Mature leaves usually less than 2 cm long (occasionally some to 2.5 cm long); mature berries burgundy; Baw Baw Plateau only
Leaf-apices acute, lamina thin, drying olive-green; stems smooth; petals 3 or more; mature berries solitary (rarely paired) on pedicel, marked with a distinct furrow
Leaf-apices obtuse to subacute, lamina coriaceous, drying brownish-rubescent; stems finely tuberculate; petals 2; berries 2–6 (–11) per pedicel
